intro: [WRONG START] Aeonium × claperaa, commonly known as the Claperae Aeonium, is a hybrid succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped growth pattern, with thick, fleshy leaves that are often blue-green in color. The plant produces striking clusters of yellow-orange flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Due to its ornamental value, it is popular among gardeners and succulent enthusiasts.
